{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} '''Stefan Grimm''' (1963 - 2014) was a biologist who held a Chair in Toxicology at [[Imperial College London]]. He worked on signalling cascades in the development of tumors. Grimm was found dead in Northwood, Middlesex on 25 September 2014 after being told that he was "struggling to fulfil the metrics" of a professorial post by his head of department.{{Cite web|title = Imperial College professor Stefan Grimm ‘was given grant income target’|url = https://www.timeshighereducation.com/news/imperial-college-professor-stefan-grimm-was-given-grant-income-target/2017369.article|accessdate = 2015-10-01}} The coroner described his death as "needless".{{Cite web|title = The death of Stefan Grimm was "needless". And Imperial has done nothing to prevent it happening again|url = http://www.dcscience.net/2015/04/09/the-death-of-stefan-grimm-was-needless-and-imperial-has-done-nothing-to-prevent-it-happening-again/|accessdate = 2015-10-01}} == Early career == Grimm studied for his PhD under the supervision of [[Patrick A. Baeuerle|Patrick Bäuerle]] at the [[University of Tübingen]], working on the role of NFκB in cell transformation and apoptosis. From 1995 to 1998 he was postdoctoral fellow with [[Philip Leder]] at Harvard University, he then took up a junior post as a group leader at the Max Planck Institute of Biochemistry. In 2004 he moved to Imperial College London, where he was appointed Professor of Toxicology. Grimm's research programme focused primarily on [[apoptosis]], signalling pathways, and tumour-genesis. Here, he made fundamental contributions to the understanding of the molecular and cellular mechanisms of cell death in connection with the development of cancer. In 20 years, he published 50 journal articles, two books, and filed 5 patent applications.{{Cite web|url = http://www3.imperial.ac.uk/newsandeventspggrp/imperialcollege/newssummary/news_14-1-2015-17-40-44|title = Obituary - Professor Stefan Grimm, 1963 - 2014|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} == Death and Events at Imperial College London == Grimm was found dead at his home in Middlesex on 25 September 2014 with typed notes next to his body.{{Cite web|title = Stefan Grimm inquest: new policies may not have prevented suicide|url = https://www.timeshighereducation.com/news/stefan-grimm-inquest-new-policies-may-not-have-prevented-suicide/2019563.article|accessdate = 2015-10-01}}{{Cite web|title = Stefan Grimm inquest: new policies may not have prevented suicide|url = https://www.timeshighereducation.com/news/stefan-grimm-inquest-new-policies-may-not-have-prevented-suicide/2019563.article|accessdate = 2015-10-03}} His inquest subsequently ruled that he took his life by asphyxiation. One month after his death, on 21 October, an email with the subject line ''How Professors are treated at Imperial College'', apparently set to deliver on a delay timer, was sent from the address ''professorstefangrimm@gmail.com'' to senior members of the medical faculty. In the email Grimm, describes how his head of department told him that although he had submitted the highest number of grant applications in the medical faculty, and despite already acquiring £135,000 in grant income, he needed to obtain a programme grant or '''start to give serious consideration as to whether you are performing at the expected level of a Professor at Imperial College.''' In his last email Grimm had this to say of the senior staff in his faculty:
''These formidable leaders are playing an interesting game: They hire scientists from other countries to submit the work that they did abroad under completely different conditions for the Research Assessment that is supposed to gauge the performance of British universities. Afterwards they leave them alone to either perform with grants or being kicked out. Even if your work is submitted to this Research Assessment and brings in money for the university, you are targeted if your grant income is deemed insufficient. Those submitted to the research assessment hence support those colleagues who are unproductive but have grants. Grant income is all that counts here, not scientific output.''
Of Imperial College London he said,
''This is not a university anymore but a business with [a] very few up in the hierarchy... profiteering [while] the rest of us are milked for money, be it professors for their grant income or students who pay 100 pounds just to extend their write-up status.''
The Rector of Imperial College, [[Alice Gast]] gave credence to Grimm's analogy, when she described university professors as "really like small business owners... they have their own research and they have their research funding to look after."{{Cite web|title = President of Imperial College London: "Professors are really like small business owners"|url = http://markcarrigan.net/2015/04/17/president-of-imperial-college-london-professors-are-really-like-small-business-owners/|website = Mark Carrigan|accessdate = 2015-10-03}} On 1 December, [[David Colquhoun]], Emeritus Professor of Pharmacology at UCL and long-time critic of managerialism and research assessment in British Universities wrote a blog post entitled ''“Publish and perish at Imperial College London: the death of Stefan Grimm."'' Colquhoun published both Grimm's email and the emails sent by his head of department.{{Cite web|title = Publish and perish at Imperial College London: the death of Stefan Grimm|url = http://www.dcscience.net/2014/12/01/publish-and-perish-at-imperial-college-london-the-death-of-stefan-grimm/|accessdate = 2015-10-01}} The post was viewed 196,000 times in the year after Grimm's death. The day after it was posted it Colquhoun's web server received so many page requests it failed.{{Cite web|title = Stefan Grimmm (1963 – 2014). A memorial to a victim of managerialism|url = http://www.dcscience.net/2015/09/24/stefan-grimmm-1963-2014-a-memorial-to-a-victim-of-managerialism/|accessdate = 2015-10-01}} Colquhoun described Imperial's performance targets as "a recipe for short term, unoriginal research. It’s an incentive to cut corners... It is a prostitution of science." On 4 December, Imperial issued a statement via Caroline Davis, its Communications and Public Affairs Reporter. The statement expressed sadness at the "tragic loss" of Professor Grimm and reported that "senior colleagues have offered their deepest condolences to Stefan’s family on behalf of the college and all those affected by this tragedy". The statement denied "claims appearing on the internet...[that] Professor Grimm's work was ... under formal review [or that]... he had been given any notice of dismissal."{{Cite web|url = http://www3.imperial.ac.uk/newsandeventspggrp/imperialcollege/newssummary/news_4-12-2014-18-0-17#authorbox|title = Statement on Professor Stefan Grimm|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} Imperial commissioned an internal review into its performance management procedures, commenting:
"Professor Grimm had been under review in the informal process for nearly two years. His line manager was using this period to help Professor Grimm obtain funding or alternative work (the review panel saw evidence of the efforts made in this regard). The subsequent formal process would have involved a minimum of two formal meetings with time to improve in-between formal meetings before consideration would have been given to the termination of Professor Grimm’s employment. Understandably there is a reluctance to move into formal hearings, particularly when the member of staff is hard working and diligent, but the formal stages would have provided more clarity to Professor Grimm on process and support through the written documentation, representation at meetings and HR involvement."
''"It is recommended that the new capability procedure and ordinance include greater clarity on timescales for informal action and how this might operate in different roles.''"
Colquhoun commented: "It seems to be absurd to describe...[the head of department's email]... as an attempt to 'help' Professor Grimm. It was a direct threat to the livelihood of a competent 51 year-old full professor. Having flow charts for the [[Workplace bullying in academia|bullying]] would not have helped." ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Grimm, Stefan}} [[Category:Academics of Imperial College London]] [[Category:Bullying]] [[Category:Workplace bullying]] [[Category:2014 deaths]] [[Category:Suicides in London]] [[Category:History of mental health in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:University of Tübingen alumni]] [[Category:1963 births]]

A '''systemic problem''' is a problem due to issues inherent in the overall system,<ref name="NIHb"> "Health Care Renewal: The NIH: "We Have a Systemic Problem", HCRenewal, 2009, webpage: [http://hcrenewal.blogspot.com/2005/02/<!-- -->nih-we-have-systemic-problem.html HCR-syst-prob]. </ref><ref name=""> "Data Vulnerability is a Systemic Problem", Torin Monahan, [[Arizona State University]], May 2006, webpage: [http://torinmonahan.com/papers/Monahan_ID_theft.pdf TM-prob]. </ref> rather than due to a specific, individual, isolated factor. Contrast with [[pilot error]], [[user error]], or [[wikt:mistake|mistake]].
A change to the structure, organization or policies in that system could alleviate the systemic problem. On an [[Ishikawa diagram]] (fishbone diagram) of cause-and-effect links, the source of the problem can be said to be a [[common cause]], rather than a [[special cause]].
==See also== * [[Systematic error]] * [[Systemic bias]] – an unbalanced issue due to the system rather than to individuals * [[Six Sigma]] * [[Structural fix]]

{{distinguish|The Assassins of Rome}} {{Infobox film | name = The Assassin of Rome | image = The Assassin of Rome.jpg | caption = | director = [[Damiano Damiani]] | writer =Damiano Damiani
Fulvio Gicca Palli
[[Enrico Ribulsi]] | starring = [[Nino Manfredi]]
[[Gabriele Lavia]] | music = [[Riz Ortolani]] | cinematography = [[Marcello Gatti]] | editing = [[Nino Baragli]] | producer =[[Dino De Laurentiis]] | distributor = | released = {{Film date|1972}} | runtime = | awards = | country = Italy | language = Italian | budget = }} '''''The Assassin of Rome''''' ({{lang-it|Girolimoni, il mostro di Roma}}) is a 1972 [[Cinema of Italy|Italian]] [[historical drama film]] directed by [[Damiano Damiani]]. The film tells, with some historical licenses, the story of [[Gino Girolimoni]], wrongfully accused of a series of child murders that occurred in Rome between 1924 and 1928.{{cite book|last=Giovanni Ziccardi|title=Il diritto al cinema|publisher=Giuffrè Editore, 2010}}{{cite book|last=Matteo Balestrieri|title=Vero Come La Finzione|publisher=Springer, 2010}} == Cast == *[[Nino Manfredi]] as Gino Girolimoni *[[Gabriele Lavia]] as Tarquinio Tirabosco * Eleonora Morana as Armanda Tirabosco *[[Orso Maria Guerrini]] as Gianni Di Meo * [[Guido Leontini]] as Apicella *[[Mario Carotenuto]] as Sterbini *[[Laura De Marchi]] as The servant *[[Luciano Catenacci]] as [[Benito Mussolini]] *[[Arturo Dominici]] as Jaccarino *[[Ennio Antonelli (actor)|Ennio Antonelli]] as The lover of the mother of 'Biocchetta' *[[Nello Pazzafini]] as Fiaccarini ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading == * Damiano Damiani, Gaetano Strazzulla. {{Infobox wrestling event |name=Triplemanía XVI |image=TriplemaniaXVILogo.jpg |caption=The official Triplemanía XVI logo |promotion=[[Asistencia Asesoría y Administración]] |date=June 13, 2008<ref name="Trip16">{{cite web | url = http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/triple.html#xvi| title = Asistencia Asesoría y Administración TripleManía | accessdate = February 19, 2009|date=June 13, 2008| publisher = ProWrestlingHistory.com}}</ref> |attendance=19,000<ref name="Trip16"/> |venue=[[Palacio de los Deportes]]<ref name="Trip16"/> |city=Mexico City, Mexico<ref name="Trip16"/> |lastevent=[[Rey de Reyes (2008)]] |nextevent = [[Verano de Escándalo (2008)]] |event=[[Triplemanía]] |lastevent2=[[Triplemanía XV]] |nextevent2=[[Triplemanía XVII]] }} '''Triplemanía XVI''' was the sixteenth [[Triplemanía]] [[professional wrestling]] show scripted and produced by [[Asistencia Asesoría y Administración]] (AAA). The show took place on June 13, 2008 in Mexico City, Mexico. The show was available on [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) in Mexico, the first Triplemanía show to be offered on PPV. The main event featured a [[Professional wrestling match types#Variations of singles matches|singles match]] for the [[AAA Mega Championship]]. Champion [[Cibernético]] defended against [[El Zorro (wrestler)|El Zorro]].
The show also featured the surprise return of [[Silver King (wrestler)|Silver King]], who teamed up with [[Chessman (wrestler)|Chessman]] and [[La Parka II|La Parka]], only to lose to ''[[La Legión Extranjera]]'' ([[Bobby Lashley]], [[Electroshock (wrestler)|Electroshock]] and [[Kenzo Suzuki]]) in the semi-main event of the show. The show also included a [[hardcore wrestling|hardcore match]] between [[Vampiro]] and [[El Mesías]], as well as a ''[[Lucha de Apuestas]]'', or "bet match", where sisters [[Faby Apache]] and [[Mari Apache]] both put their hair on the line for the match. The show include four additional matches.
==Production==
===Background=== [[File:Ciber Nuevo Perro del Mal.jpg|thumb|left|[[Cibernético]] reigning [[AAA Mega Championship|AAA Mega Champion]] going into the event.]] In early 1992 [[Antonio Peña]] was working as a booker and storyline writer for [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] (CMLL), Mexico's largest and the world's oldest wrestling promotion, and was frustrated by CMLL's very conservative approach to ''[[lucha libre]]''. He joined forced with a number of younger, very talented wrestlers who felt like CMLL was not giving them recognition they deserved and decided to split from CMLL to create [[Asistencia Asesoría y Administración]] (AAA, or Triple A; Spanish for "Assistance, Assessment, and Administration"). After making a deal with the [[Televisa]] television network AAA held their first show in April, 1992.<ref name=SLOrbit>{{cite web | url= http://superluchas.com/2006/10/07/el-fin-de-una-era/| title= El fin de una era| date= October 7, 2006 | accessdate= October 14, 2009 | author= Ocampo, Ernesto | publisher= ''SuperLuchas'' Magazine | language=Spanish}}</ref> The following year Peña and AAA held their first [[Triplemanía]] event, building it into an annual event that would become AAA's [[Super Bowl]] event, similar to the [[WWE]]'s [[WrestleMania]] being the biggest show of the year.<ref>{{cite book|author=Madigan, Dan|title=Mondo Lucha Libre: the bizarre and honorable world of wild Mexican wrestling|publisher=HarperColins Publisher|year=2007|chapter=A family affair|pages=128–132|isbn=978-0-06-085583-3}}</ref> The 2009 Triplemanía was the 16th year in a row AAA held a Triplemanía show and the 21st overall show under the Triplemanía banner.
Up until Triplemanía XVI, the Triplemanía shows were taped for television broadcast, televised weeks after the show as part of AAA's regular television series. Triplemanía XVI was the first AAA show to also be offered as a [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) service on Mexican PPV channels.<ref name=PPV>{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/triple.html | title=Triplemania | accessdate=July 17, 2016 | publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> While PPV broadcasts of major events was common in the United States, going back to the mid-1980s, Mexican wrestling promotions only intermittently offered PPV options for their major shows prior to 2008.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/ppv.html | title=EMLL Pay-Per-Views | accessdate=July 17, 2016 | publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> In subsequent years Triplemanía shows would be offered on PPV in Mexico and, for some events, outside of Mexico via internet or US PPV options.<ref name=PPV/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Angelita|first1=Dark|title=La edición 22 de Triplemania en PPV por SKY y por Internet|url=https://superluchas.com/2014/07/29/aaa-triplemania-xxii-podra-ser-vista-en-pago-por-evento-y-por-ippv/|publisher=SuperLuchas|accessdate=July 16, 2015|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/101-mexico/43679-triplemania-to-be-on-us-and-canadian-ppv | title=TripleMania to be on U.S. and Canadian PPV | work=[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | date=July 22, 2015 | accessdate=July 22, 2015}}</ref>
The 2008 Triplemanía show ran live against Mexican rival promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre's (CMLL) [[Infierno en el Ring (2008)|Infierno en el Ring]] ("Inferno in the ring") major event.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2008/06/12/listos-infierno-en-el-ring-y-triplemania-xvi | title=Listos ';Infierno en el ring'; y Triplemanía XVI para este viernes | date=June 12, 2008 | accessdate=July 22, 2016 | publisher=[[MSN]] | work=MedioTiempo}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.net/2008/06/15/resultados-infierno-en-el-ring-en-vivo/|title=Resultados Infierno en el Ring en Vivo!|author=Yoav|date=June 15, 2008|accessdate=September 21, 2009|work=SuperLuchas|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref name=Infierno2008>{{cite news|title=Hijo del Texano Rapó Heavy Metal|work=SuperLuchas|id=issue 268|date=June 29, 2008|language=Spanish}}</ref> Both Triplemanía and Infierno en el Ring were held in Mexico City, Triplemanía at the approximately 20,000 seat [[Palacio de los Deportes]] arena while Infierno en el Ring was held at the 16,500 seat [[Arena México]].<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Infierno2008/> The special entrance set, complete with large video walls and decorations, constructed specifically for Triplemanía XVI and the PPV production set up reportedly cost three million [[Mexican peso|pesos]] ($290,000) and took 150 workers to prepare.<ref>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080618211936/http://www.elmanana.com.mx/notas.asp?id=62241 | url=http://www.elmanana.com.mx/notas.asp?id=62241 | title=Hoy es Triplemanía XVI | date=June 13, 2008 | archivedate=June 18, 2008 | accessdate=July 23, 2016 | publisher=El Manana | language=Spanish}}</ref> Tickets for the event ranged from 150 pesos ($14.50) to 950 pesos ($92.02) for ringside seats.<ref>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080612022627/http://www.superluchas.net/?p=4706 | url=http://www.superluchas.net/?p=4706| title=CMLL (Infierno en el Ring) vs AAA (TripleMania XVI) | date=June 3, 2008 | archivedate=June 12, 2008 | accessdate=July 23, 2016 | publisher=SuperLuchas Magazine | language=Spanish | first=Jorge | last=Ocampo Alcazar}}</ref> ''[[El Economista (Mexico)|El Economista]]'' reported that 406 police officers, spread out over 52 units, provided security for the event.<ref>{{cite web | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080617171724/http://www.economista.com.mx/articulos/2008-06-13-65136 | url=http://www.economista.com.mx/articulos/2008-06-13-65136 | date=June 13, 2008 | archivedate=June 17, 2008 | title=Vigilarán 1,800 policías eventos en el DF | accessdate=July 23, 2016 | publisher=El Economista | language=Spanish}}</ref>
{{clear}}
===Storylines=== [[File:Arms (2971269439).jpg|thumb|right|[[Bobby Lashley]], brought to Mexico specifically for the show.]]
The Triplemanía XVI show featured a total of seven [[Professional wrestling match types|professional wrestling matches]] with where some wrestlers were involved [[Screenplay|scripted]] feuds. Wrestlers were portrayed as either [[Heel (professional wrestling)|heels]] (referred to as ''rudos'' in Mexico, those that portray the "bad guys") or [[Face (professional wrestling)|faces]] (''técnicos'' in Mexico, the "good guy" characters) as they followed a series of tension-building events, which culminated in a wrestling match or series of matches.
[[AAA Mega Champion]] [[Cibernético]] and challenger [[El Zorro (wrestler)|El Zorro]] had been rivals for almost a year prior to Triplemanía XVI, starting when both Cibernético and El Zorro targeted then AAA Mega Champion [[El Mesías]]. The championship feud build from the overarching AAA storyline featuring ''[[La Legión Extranjera]]'' ("The Foreign Legion") fighting against the Mexicans representing AAA. El Mesías, from Puerto Rico, was one of the major figures in ''La Legión Extranjera'', teaming with US representative [[Sean Waltman]] and Japanese wrestler [[Kenzo Suzuki]] in the main event of [[Triplemanía XV]]. The trio lost to ''[[Los Hell Brothers]]'' (Cibernético, [[Charly Manson]] and [[Chessman (wrestler)|Chessman]]).<ref name="Trip15">{{cite web | url = http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/triple.html#xv| title = Asistencia Asesoría y Administración TripleManía | accessdate = July 22, 2016|date=July 15, 2007| publisher = ProWrestlingHistory.com}}</ref> In September 2007 ''Los Hell Brothers'' teamed up with El Zorro to wrestle against [[the Black Family]] ([[Dark Cuervo]], [[Dark Escoria]], [[Dark Espiritu]] and [[Dark Ozz]]) in the main event of the 2007 [[Verano de Escándalo (2007)|Verano de Escándalo]] show. Zorro escaped early on in the match leaving his team at a disadvantage. After ''Los Hell Brothers'' won the match a man came to the ring wearing the "iron mask" but that turned out to be Konnan. When Zorro appeared on the scene moments later he turned on the ''tecnicos'', attacking them with a [[Shinai|kendo stick]].<ref name="Verano2007">{{cite web | url = http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/verano.html#2007| title = Asistencia Asesoria y Administracion Verano de Escandalo | accessdate = July 22, 2016| date=September 16, 2007 | publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> After the show Zorro claimed that he was shown the light; he was actually a [[Spain|Spaniard]], not Mexican, and was against the Mexican contingent in AAA. Joining Konnan's ''La Legión Extranjera''.<ref name=ZorroIronMaskHistory>{{cite web |url= http://luchalibreaaa.com/180606-el-zorro-y-la-mascara-de-hierro-se-encuentran-por-primera-vez.php | title= 18/06/06: El Zorro y la máscara de hierro se encuentran por primera vez | date=July 19, 2011| accessdate=July 22, 2016 | work=AAA | language=Spanish | archivedate=August 16, 2011 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110816110249/http://luchalibreaaa.com/180606-el-zorro-y-la-mascara-de-hierro-se-encuentran-por-primera-vez.php}}</ref>
After Zorro's turn the story was that Konnan considered El Zorro his "main man", the two even turned on El Mesías and ''[[La Secta (professional wrestling)|La Secta del Mesías]]'' when El Mesías did not want to grant Zorro a title match. The storyline lead to a three-way world title match between Zorro, El Mesías and Cibernético at [[Guerra de Titanes (2007)|Guerra de Titanes]] ("War of the Titans"). During the match Cibernético received [[Burn|second and third burns]] to his back after ''La Legión'' put him through a table on fire (Cibernético was legitimately injured, it was not planned).<ref name="Titanes2007">{{cite web | url = http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/guerra.html#2007| title = Asistencia Asesoria y Administracion Guerra de Titanes| accessdate = July 11, 2016| date=November 20, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> A few weeks later, the storyline continued as El Zorro and the rest of ''La Legión Extranjera'' attacked and "injured" El Mesias during a show. The storyline was done partially to cover up the fact that El Mesias was returning Puerto Rico, as well as to help establish El Zorro as a top ''rudo'' in AAA.<ref name=Lucha2007>{{cite news|title=2007 Lo Mejor de la Lucha Mexicana|work=SuperLuchas|id=issue 244|date=December 26, 2007|url=http://superluchas.com/2007/12/26/superluchas-224-lo-mejor-del-2007/|accessdate=July 11, 2009|language=Spanish}}</ref> At the 2008 [[Rey de Reyes (2008)|Rey de Reyes]] ("King of Kings") El Zorro won the Rey de Reyes tournament, while Cibernético finally defeated El Mesías to win the AAA Mega Championship.<ref name="Rey2008">{{cite web | url = http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/rey.html#2008 | title = Asistencia Asesoria y Administracion Rey de Reyes Tournament | accessdate = February 19, 2009 | date = March 16, 2008 | publisher = ProWrestlingHistory.com | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090301173345/http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/rey.html#2008 | archivedate = March 1, 2009 | df = }}</ref> With his victory in the Rey de Reyes tournament El Zorro also earned a championship match at Triplemanía XVI.<ref name=Lucha2008/> The original plan for the main event was to have AAA promoter Joaquín Roldán at ringside for the match, but the Mexico City boxing and wrestling commission would not allow it because he was not a licensed active competitor and the plan included Roldán getting physically involved.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.superluchas.net/?p=4674 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080606010208/http://www.superluchas.net/?p=4674 | title=Triplemania XVI, fricciones con la comisión de Box y Lucha del DF | date=June 2, 2008 | accessdate=July 23, 2016 | archivedate=June 6, 2008 | publisher=SuperLuchas Magazine | language=Spanish| first=Jorge | last=Ocampo}}</ref>
Another featured match of Triplemanía XVI was a long-running "family feud" between sisters [[Mari Apache]] and [[Faby Apache]] that also included their father, [[Gran Apache]], Faby's husband[[Billy Boy (wrestler)|Billy Boy]] their son Marvin "Apache". The storyline started out in 2005 with Billy Boy approaching the ring when Faby Apache was in a match. He usually carried flowers with him, and at times even carrying signs where he professed his love. The two had dated for years in real life prior to the storyline, and had in fact gotten married around the same time, writing their real life relationship into a storyline.<ref name=WrestleView>{{cite web | url=http://www.wrestleview.com/news08/1228001057.shtml | title= !Viva La Raza! # Dos: Lucha News! | author= Boutwell, Josh | date= November 29, 2008 | accessdate= February 24, 2010 | publisher=WrestleView.com}}</ref> The problems began when Faby Apache's father, Gran Apache, objected to the relationship and attacked Billy Boy because he was not "worthy" of his daughter, he was not tough enough for Gran Apache's liking. The Family feud stretched out for several years and even had the birth of Faby and Billy Boy's son Marvin incorporated into the storyline. The feud saw Gran Apache defeat Billy Boy in a match where he would be forced to not have anything to do with either Faby Apache or his son. Following the loss the storyline was that Billy Boy was so depressed that he caused his team ''[[Los Barrio Boys]]'' to lose several matches, this in turn, led to [[Drago (wrestler)|Alan]] and Decnnis turning on Billy Boy, taking Gran Apache's side in the storyline.<ref name=WrestleView/> On May 28, 2008 Faby Apache defeated [[Ayako Hamada]] and Mari Apache to win the 2008 ''[[AAA Reina de Reinas Championship|Reina de Reinas]]'' ("Queen of Queens") tournament, moving the storyline onto focusing on Faby and her older sister Mari Apache, who chose to side with her father in the storyline.<ref name=Lucha2008/> The two sisters agreed to put their hair on the line in a ''[[Lucha de Apuestas]]'', or "bet match", at Triplemanía XVI.<ref name=OriginalCard/>
One of the featured storylines that was supposed to culminate at Triplemanía XVI focused on the internal struggles of a ''rudo'' group known as ''[[Los Vipers]]'', initially between ''Los Vipers'' leader [[Abismo Negro]] and [[Black Abyss]], a wrestler using a very similar ring character. Initially, it was believed that the Black Abyss character was introduced due to rumors of Abismo Negro jumping to CMLL or to cover several [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#No-show|no-shows]].<ref name=SL308>{{cite news|last=Flores|first=Manuel|title=Abismo Negro Adiós al rey de marinete|work= SuperLuchas|id=308|location=[[Mexico City]], [[Mexican Federal District|D.F.]]|pages=24–26|date=2009-03-30|language=Spanish}}</ref> During that time Mr. Niebla had begun challenging Abismo Negro's position as the leader of ''Los Vipers'', backing Black Abyss in the feud. At the 2008 ''Rey de Reyes'' show Abismo Negro lost due to interference from Black Abyss.<ref name="Rey2008"/> The tension led to Abismo Negro and Mr. Niebla physically fightighting each other over the leadership, wrestling in matches where the ''Los Vipers'' leadership was on the line. Abismo Negro won the matches, but each time AAA head booker Joaquín Roldan announced that the decision had been overturned for various reasons. After the second match the rest of ''Los Vipers'' turned on Abismo Negro and kicked him out of the group, making Mr. Niebla their leader instead.<ref name=Lucha2008/> The storyline was supposed to end in a ''Luchas de Apuestas'' match between Niebla and Negro at Triplemanía XVI. Later on the match was changed to a multi-man [[Professional wrestling match types#Cages|steel cage match]] including all of Los Vipers (Mr. Niebla, Black Abyss, [[Psicosis II]] and [[Histeria (wrestler)|Histeria]]) and Abismo Negro with the last person in the cage being forced to unmask<ref name=OriginalCard>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080612022627/http://www.superluchas.net/?p=4372 | url=http://www.superluchas.net/?p=4372 | title=¿El cartel de Triplemania XVI? | date= May 19, 2008 | archivedate=June 12, 2008 | accessdate=July 23, 2016 | first=Jorge | last=Ocampo Alcazar | publisher=SuperLuchas Magazine | language=Spanish}}</ref> A few days before the show the steel cage match as canceled with AAA claiming that Abismo Negro had suffered a neck injury.<ref name=SL308/>
==Event== [[File:Kenzo Suzuki cropped.jpg|thumb|left|[[Kenzo Suzuki]], part of ''[[La Legión Extranjera]]'']]
For the opening match [[Laredo Kid]] was originally scheduled to be part of the match, but for unexplained reasons did not work the match, leaving his fellow ''[[Real Fuerza Aérea]]'' ("Royal Air Force") members [[Aero Star]], [[El Ángel (wrestler)|El Ángel]], and [[Super Fly (wrestler)|Super Fly]] one man short as they faced off against The Black Family (Dark Cuervo, Dark Escoria, Dark Espiritu and Dark Ozz).<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/>
Mr. Niebla was originally scheduled to compete in the second match of the night, but instead, he quit AAA, and made his CMLL return at Infierno en el Ring that same night. Later on Mr. Niebla later stated that he left AAA because the big mask vs. mask match he was promised fell through as Abismo Negro was unable to work the Triplemanía match.<ref name=SL286>{{cite news|author=Islas, Alejandro|title=Mr. Niebla|work=SuperLuchas|id=286|date=July 2, 2008|url=http://superluchas.net/?p=5050|accessdate=July 18, 2009|language=Spanish}}</ref> Histeria replaced Mr. Niebla in the six-man tag team match where ''Los Vipers'' lost to [[Alan Stone (wrestler)|Alan Stone]], [[Octagón]], and [[Brazo de Plata]] when Octagón pinned Histeria.<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/>
In the fourth match of the night sisters Faby and Mari Apache squared off, fighting each other with their hair on the line. Billy Boy was on the corner of his wife Faby Apache, while Gran Apache was in Mari Apache's corner for the match. The match ended with Faby Apache pinning her older sister Mari Apache. A visibly emotional Gran Apache entered the ring before Mari Apache got her hair shaved off, pleading with the officials and the crowd to have HIS hair shaved off instead, pleading for his family to reunite. As Gran Apache had his hair shaved off the Apache sisters put their differences aside, hugging their father, with Billy Boy joining in moments later, calling a truce to the long-running feud.<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/>
According to AAA, the fifth match of the night, a [[Hardcore wrestling#Rules|hardcore match]], had a fifteen-minute time limit imposed on it by the Mexico City boxing and wrestling federation, despite such matches normally not having a time limit. The added stipulation allowed AAA to have [[Vampiro]] and El Mesías, within having a conclusive winner of the match, allowing them to extend the feud. The two were fighting on the outside of the ring when the time expired, resulting in a draw.<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/>
For the semi-final match a wheelchair bound Charly Manson entered the arena to introduce the ''luchador sorpresa'' ("surprise wrestler") that had been advertised and Chessman and La Parka's tag team partner. AAA played "[[Bad Medicine (song)|Bad Medicine]]" over the PA system, normally the theme song of [[Dr. Wagner Jr.]] (who was wrestling for CMLL), as they introduced Dr. Wagner Jr.'s brother [[Silver King (wrestler)|Silver King]] as the surprise wrestler, confirming rumors reported by newspapers earlier in the day.<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.oem.com.mx/esto/notas/n732436.htm | title=Bobby Lashley en México | first=Alfredo | last=Ascencio | date=June 13, 2008 | accessdate=July 23, 2016 | work=ESTO | publisher= O.E.M. | language=Spanish}}</ref> Silver King surprised everyone by wearing his [[wrestling mask]], after not having worn it for over 20 years. In ''Lucha Libre'' it is normally not allowed for a wrestler to resume wearing a mask they have previously lost in a ''Lucha de Apuestas'', but for this occasion Silver King and AAA ignored the tradition.<ref name=Mondo>{{cite book|author=Madigan, Dan|title=Mondo Lucha A Go-Go: the bizarre and honorable world of wild Mexican wrestling|publisher=HarperColins Publisher|year=2007|chapter=Okay... what is Lucha Libre?|pages=29–40|isbn=978-0-06-085583-3}}</ref> The match ended when Suzuki hit Silver King with a low blow behind the referee's back and pinned him, winning the match for his side.<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/>
In the main event Cibernético had the odds stacked against him, starting with El Tirantes being named the referee, El Tirantes played the role of a crooked referee who supported ''La Legión Extranjera'' whenever he had a chance. During the match against El Zorro, El Tirantes was knocked out by accident, leaving the match unsupervised for a short while. When El Zorro covered Cibernético, Konnan (El Zorro's corner man) took off his shirt to reveal a referee's shirt underneath. The ploy failed as Cibernético kicked out before the three count. Moments later El Hijo del Tirantes ("Son of El Tirantes") came to the ring to officiate the match fairly and without bias. Moments later Cibernético pinned El Zorro to retain the championship.<ref name="Trip16"/><ref name=Lucha2008/><ref name=AAATrip/>
==Aftermath== [[File:ChessmanGuerraDeTitanes.jpg|thumb|[[Chessman (wrestler)|Chessman]], the next challenger for the [[AAA Mega Championship]].]] In the lead up to AAA's next major event ''[[Verano de Escándalo (2008)|Verano de Escándalo]]'' ("Summer of Scandal") Cibernético's ''Los Hell Brothers'' team mate Chessman won an elimination match to earn a shot at the AAA Mega Championship held by Cibernético.<ref name="Contender">{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.com/2008/07/23/chessman-gana-la-eliminatoria-para-contender-por-el-mega-campeonato-triple-a/|title=Chessman gana la eliminatoria para contender por el Mega Campeonato Triple A|accessdate=February 23, 2009| date=July 23, 2008|publisher=SuperLucha|language=Spanish|first=Jorge | last=Ocampo}}</ref> Cibernético congratulated his partner for the victory, but did not agree to a date for Chessman's title match. The tension came to a head in September after Cibernético came to the ring to congratulate Chessman on a recent win. Charly Manson came to the ring to try and mediate between the two, trying to keep the peace, but when Manson could not pick sides, ''Los Hell Brothers'' disbanded.<ref name="HellBrothersEnd">{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.com/2008/09/03/triple-a-en-nuevo-laredo-electroshock-sin-cabellera-oficial-ruptura-de-los-hell-brothers/|title=Triple A en Nuevo Laredo: Electroshock sin cabellera, oficial ruptura de los hell brothers|accessdate=February 23, 2009 | date=September 3, 2009 | first=Jorge | last=Ocampo|publisher=SuperLucha|language=Spanish}}</ref> With the split of ''Los Hell Brothers, Chessman'' became a ''Rudo'' and the title match was scheduled for ''Verano de Escandalo''. Cibernético retained the championship in a very close match.<ref name="Verano2008">{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/verano.html#2008|title=Asistencia Asesoria y Administracion Verano de Escandalo|accessdate=February 19, 2009|date=September 14, 2008|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> Chessman was later given another match for the AAA Mega Championship, a match that also included El Zorro, which took place at the 2008 [[Antonio Peña Memorial Show (2008)|Antonio Peña Memorial Show]], a match Cibernético won by pinning El Zorro.<ref name=Cup2008>{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/aaa/misccards.html#pena2007|title=AAA Misc. Cards – Pena Memorial show 2008|accessdate=February 13, 2009| date=October 24, 2008|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref>
The predominant storyline after Triplemanía XVI featured the Konnan-led ''La Legión Extranjera'' group as they continued their efforts to take control of AAA. By winning the main event of the Antonio Peña Memorial Show the storyline was that ''La Legión Extranjera'' was now running AAA, completing their takeover.<ref name=Verano2008SL>{{cite web | url= http://superluchas.net/2008/10/25/resultados-de-la-funcion-homenaje-a-antonio-pena-konnan-es-el-nuevo-director-de-aaa/ | title= Función Homenaje a Antonio Peña (24 Octubre 2008). Konnan es el nuevo director de AAA gracias a la intervención de Sergio Meyer | date= October 25, 2008 | accessdate= September 1, 2009 | author= Miguel, Jose | publisher= ''SuperLuchas'' Magazine | language= Spanish}}</ref> One of the storyline effects of the take over by Konnan and his group was that Cibernético announced that he was leaving AAA, vacating the AAA Mega Championship in the process.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.com/2008/10/27/el-cibernetico-renuncia-al-campeonato/|title=El Cibernético renuncia al campeonato|date=October 27, 2008|publisher=SúperLuchas|language = Spanish}}</ref> The storyline was pushed as supposedly being real, something that was further enhanced by Cibernético working on the [[independent circuit]] from December 2008,<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.cagematch.net/?id=2&nr=432&view=&page=4&gimmick=&year=2008&promotion=&region=&location=&arena=&showtype=&constellationType=&worker= | title= Cibernético matches in 2008 | work=Cagematch.net | accessdate=July 17, 2016}}</ref> until returning to AAA in April 2009.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.cagematch.net/?id=2&nr=432&view=&page=4&gimmick=&year=2009&promotion=&region=&location=&arena=&showtype=&constellationType=&worker= | title= Cibernético matches in 2009 | work=Cagematch.net | accessdate=July 17, 2016}}</ref>
As a follow up to the time-limit draw between Vampiro and El Mesías, the two faced off in an extreme rules match on AAA's ''Sin Límite'' television taping on July 25. That match ended in a 25-minute time-limit draw. The inconclusive ended lead to AAA booking the rematch between the two as the main event of the 2008 ''Verano de Escándalo'' show, making the match a steel cage "street fight" match, ensuring that there would be a winner.<ref name=Verano2008/> At ''Verano de Escándalo'' El Mesías defeated Vampiro to end the storyline between the two.<ref name=Verano2008/>
While the Apaches reunited at the show, the storyline didn't end there. Later in 2008 Billy Boy returned to AAA, wearing a mask to keeping his true identity secret as he wrestled under the name "Alfa". He used the ruse to try to gain Gran Apache's respect. The ploy worked to the point where Gran Apache stated that Alfa would make a good husband for Faby Apache. After hearing that Billy Boy unmasked himself and reunited with Faby Apache and Marvin. The ruse did not please Gran Apache, who still did not like Billy Boy.<ref name=WrestleView/> During the 2008 Guerra de Titanes show Billy Boy came to Faby Apache's aid after she lost a match. The frustration of the loss made Faby Apache slap Billy Boy, which in turn caused Billy Boy to attack her.<ref name=LaRazaDec132008>{{cite web | url= http://www.wrestleview.com/news08/1229196334.shtml | title= Viva La Raza! # Cuatro: Lucha News | author= Boutwell, Josh | date= December 13, 2008 | accessdate= February 26, 2010 | publisher=WrestleView}}</ref> During an in-ring celebration of Gran Apache's 50 years in professional wrestling Billy Boy attacked his father-in-law with a steel chair, reversing the roles of Billy Boy and Gran Apache at that point in the storyline.<ref name=LaRazaMarch62009>{{cite web | url= http://www.wrestleview.com/news2009/1236332886.php | title= Viva La Raza! Lucha Weekly | author= Boutwell, Josh | date= March 6, 2009 | accessdate= February 26, 2010 | publisher=WrestleView}}</ref> In the spring of 2010 Aero Star was brought into the family feud, portraying a new love interest for Faby Apache. To begin with, Billy Boy acted like he did not care, stating that he had moved on as well and found a new love in [[Sexi Star]].<ref name=LaRazaMarch202009>{{cite web | url= http://www.wrestleview.com/news2009/1237534446.php | title= Viva La Raza! Lucha Weekly | author= Boutwell, Josh | date= March 20, 2009 | accessdate= February 26, 2010 | publisher=WrestleView}}</ref> During a show Aero Star came to the ring and asked Gran Apache's permission to ask Faby Apache out. When Gran Apache was about to say yes Billy Boy ran to the ring and attached Aero Star.<ref name=LaRazaMarch272009>{{cite web | url= http://www.wrestleview.com/news2009/1238131291.php | title= Viva La Raza! Lucha Weekly | author= Boutwell, Josh | date= March 27, 2009 | accessdate= February 26, 2010 | publisher=WrestleView}}</ref> This led to Faby, Sexi Star, Billy Boy and Aero Star being booked in an inter-gender ''Lucha de Apuesta'' steel cage match where the last person in the ring would either have their hair shaved off (Faby Apache or Billy Boy) or be forced to unmask (Aero Star or Sexi Star). The match came down to Faby Apache and Billy Boy in the cage with Faby Apache pinning Billy to win the match.<ref name=Verano>{{cite web | url= http://superluchas.net/2009/08/21/aaa-verano-de-escandalo-2009-resultados-21-agosto-dr-wagner-jr-vs-el-mesias-vs-cibernetico/ | title= AAA Verano de Escándalo 2009 (Resultados 21 agosto) – Dr. Wagner Jr. retiene el Megacampeonato – Aparece Gron XXX – Roxxi se presenta con AAA | date= August 21, 2009 | accessdate= August 22, 2009 | publisher= ''SuperLuchas'' Magazine | language= Spanish}}</ref> Following the ''Apuesta'' loss the storyline has focused more on Faby Apache and Sexi Star than Billy Boy.<ref name=GdT2009>{{cite web | url=http://superluchas.net/2009/12/11/aaa-guerra-de-titanes-resultados-en-vivo-11-diciembre-2009-por-el-mega-campeonato-dr-wagner-jr-c-vs-el-mesias-konnan-vs-cibernetico/ | title= AAA- Guerra de Titanes (Resultados en vivo 11 diciembre 2009) – El Mesías venció a Dr. Wagner – Konnan y su gente destrozan a Cibernético | date= December 11, 2009 | accessdate= December 12, 2009 | publisher=''SuperLuchas'' Magazine | language=Spanish}}</ref>
With Joe Lider turning on the Mexican Powers and Nicho el Millonario turning on ''La Familia'' the two, along with [[X-Fly]], formed a new group known as ''La Hermandad 187'' ("The [[187 (slang)|187]] Brotherhood"), fighting with both the Mexican Powers and ''La Familia de Tijuana''. Nicho and Lider won a [[Ladder match]] at ''Verano de Escándalo'' defeating the Mexican Powers (Crazy Boy and Último Gladiador), ''La Familia de Tijuana'' (Extreme Tiger and Halloween), and [[The Hart Foundation 2.0]] (Jack Evans and Teddy Hart) to win the [[AAA World Tag Team Championship]].<ref name=Verano2008/>
Triplemanía XVI would later be released on DVD through ''Televisa'' Home Entertainment.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.televisa.com/home-entertainment/catalogos/especiales/006919/triplemania-xvi-televisa-home-entertainment/ | title=Triplemania XVI | publisher=[[Televisa]] Home Entertainment | accessdate=July 22, 2016 | language=Spanish}}</ref>

{{notability|date=December 2011}}
'''Twins Days''' is a festival for biological [[twin]]s (and other multiples, e.g. triplets, quads) which has taken place every summer since 1976 in [[Twinsburg, Ohio]], when the festival was founded by A group of Twinsburg citizens including Ray Diersing, who who helped create it for his daughters. It is the largest annual gathering of twins in the world, and draws thousands of participants from all over the [[United States]] and elsewhere in the world.
The event, which takes place on the first full weekend in August, routinely attracts about 2,000 pairs of twins. About 1,140 sets of multiples pre-registered for the 2014 festival, including people from Nigeria, Brazil, Australia, Ghana, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, France, Italy, England, Belgium, Germany, Japan, China and India. The 2014 festival was themed as a "peace and love" event, and billed as "Twinstock: Groovy in Twinsburg".<ref>[http://www.hudsonhubtimes.com/regional/2014/07/29/twins-days-festival-sets-stage-for-groovy-weekend-in-twinsburg/ Howard,Conner, "Twins Days Festival Sets Stage for Groovy Weekend in Twinsburg", ''Hudson Hub-Times'' (July 29, 2014)]</ref>
The festival has developed its own traditions over the years. As the writer [[Tony Barrell (journalist)|Tony Barrell]] noted in a major press article in 2003, “An unwritten festival rule means that identical twins are identically dressed, too. This applies as much to 70-year-old men as to 17-year-old girls, and to tiny babies, wheeled around in fleets of twin buggies.”<ref name=TBarrell>[http://www.tonybarrell.com/the-twinsburg-chronicles/ Barrell, Tony, "The Twinsburg Chronicles", ''Sunday Times'' (November 16, 2003)]</ref> The festival is opened every year with a performance of [[The Star-Spangled Banner]], sung by John and Jerry Starlet and signed in [[American Sign Language|ASL]] by Jamie Maassen and Jodie Qualkinbush, and a [[parade]] along Ravenna Road (former [[Ohio State Route 14|SR-14]]).
The festival attracts many members of the scientific community, who use the presence of thousands of identical and fraternal twins to conduct voluntary [[twin studies]], in order to determine the genetic or non-genetic basis of a wide range of human traits. Twins are customarily rewarded for their participation.<ref name=TBarrell/>
Barrell also noted that there was a tendency among Twins Days attendees to form human patterns: “Pairs of complete strangers seem continually, magnetically drawn to one another, to shake hands, slap backs – and, sometimes, take the relationship further... Another extraordinary thing is happening: clumps of twins keep making human patterns. Every few seconds, two or three or more sets get together in symmetrical formations and smile for somebody’s camera. They seem powerless to resist the compulsion, and watching it is like seeing the colors coalesce in a giant kaleidoscope.”<ref name=TBarrell/>
==History== The Twins Days event was inspired by a pair of enterprising 19th-century twins, Moses and Aaron Wilcox. “They were the identical twins who bought about 4,000 acres of land here in 1819, and then offered to donate six acres for a town square and $20 towards a new school, on one condition: that the place drop its dull old name, Millsville, and become Twinsburg. More than a century and a half later, in 1976, the town was celebrating the [[United States Bicentennial|United States’ bicentennial]] and decided to throw a party the Wilcoxes would have appreciated. Just 36 pairs of twins showed up, but the burghers of Twinsburg saw its potential and made it annual.”<ref name=TBarrell/>

[[File:OceanDriveSouthBeach.jpg|thumb|250px|Clubs and music venues on and around [[Ocean Drive (South Beach)|Ocean Drive, South Beach]] are the center of Urban Beach Week's activities.]] '''Urban Beach Week''' is a [[hip-hop]] festival held in Miami's [[South Beach]] over the [[Memorial Day]] weekend since the 1990s.<ref name="miamiherald1">{{cite news |url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_multi=MH/&p_product=MH&p_theme=realcities2&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&s_site=miami&s_trackval=MH&s_search_type=customized&s_dispstring=Title(Memorial%20Day%20beach%20parties)%20AND%20date(01/01/2011%20to%2012/31/2011)&p_field_date-0=YMD_date&p_params_date-0=date:B,E&p_text_date-0=01/01/2011%20to%2012/31/2011)&p_field_advanced-0=title&p_text_advanced-0=(Memorial%20Day%20beach%20parties)&xcal_numdocs=20&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&xcal_useweights=no#storylink=cpy |title=Miami Beach Memorial Day parties still polarizing|work=Miami Herald |date=May 27, 2011 |accessdate=2014-05-03 }}</ref> Urban Beach Week has been likened to a de facto continuation of [[Freaknik]]'s cultural activities.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.theprovidernu.com/2011/05/urban-beach-weekend-in-miami-tarnished.html |title=Urban Beach Weekend in Miami Tarnished by Gunplay, Hip-Hop Culture Takes Blame |last=Shaw |first=A.R. |work=TheProviderNu.com |date=May 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120324202606/http://www.theprovidernu.com/2011/05/urban-beach-weekend-in-miami-tarnished.html |archivedate=March 24, 2012 |accessdate=2014-05-02 }}</ref> The event has become known for its over-the-top parties and fashions.<ref name="miamiherald2">[http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/05/27/2819931/urban-beach-week-partygoers-take.html "A concert, parties and celebrities help make final days of Urban Beach Week a blast", The Miami Herald, May 27, 2012.]</ref>
The events of Urban Beach Week are typically spread over five days.<ref name="miamiherald3">[http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/05/28/2821418/success-of-beachs-memorial-day.html "“Success” of Beach’s Memorial Day weekend depends on point of view", The Miami Herald, 28.5.12]</ref> The city does not sponsor the event and there is no one organizer. Instead, it is a weekend of rolling performances in private venues.<ref name="nytimes1">[https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/26/us/as-hip-hop-devotees-come-in-many-miami-beach-residents-prepare-to-leave.html "As Hip-Hop Devotees Come in, Many Miami Beach Residents Prepare to Leave", The New York Times, May 25, 2012.]</ref>
== Visitor numbers == Estimates of those attending Urban Beach Week range from 250,000 to 350,000 visitors.<ref name="miamiherald1"/><ref>{{cite web|author=Rob McFarland |url=http://www.smh.com.au/travel/hiphop-and-bling-on-the-boardwalk-20110319-1c0xw.html |title=Urban Beach Week, South Beach, Miami | Hip-hop and bling on the boardwalk |publisher=Smh.com.au |date= |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref>
== Major artists == While Urban Beach Week is a hip-hop dominated music event, major [[reggae]] artists from the US and abroad have also appeared.<ref name="miamiherald2"/>
Major artists who have performed at Urban Beach Week related shows include [[Flo Rida]],<ref name="nytimes1"/> [[Twista]],<ref name="nytimes1"/> [[Mr. Vegas]],<ref name="miamiherald2"/> [[Shaggy (musician)|Shaggy]],<ref name="miamiherald2"/> [[Lil Bow Wow]], [[Funkmaster Flex]],<ref name="miamiherald4">[http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/05/27/2819931_p2/urban-beach-week-partygoers-take.html "A concert, parties and celebrities help make final days of Urban Beach Week a blast", The Miami Herald, May 27, 2012.]</ref> [[Fat Joe]],<ref name="miamiherald4"/> [[Marcia Griffiths]],<ref name="miamiherald4"/> and [[Pitbull (entertainer)|Pitbull]].<ref name="miamiherald4"/>
== Local politics == Urban Beach Week has been a controversial event for the residents of South Beach.<ref name="miamiherald3"/> Violence and property crime associated with the event has turned many locals against the festival.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://miami.cbslocal.com/2011/06/02/uncle-luke-co-founder-of-urban-beach-week-no-longer-attends-event/ |title=Uncle Luke, Co-Founder Of Urban Beach Week, No Longer Attends Event « CBS Miami |publisher=Miami.cbslocal.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref><ref name="nytimes1"/> It was reported in the New York Times that many South Beach residents leave the area during Urban Beach Week.<ref name="nytimes1"/>
Mayor [[Matti Herrera Bower]] has said the city doesn't have much ability to end Urban Beach Week, considering that the tourists who come for the Memorial weekend don't come for city permitted events, but for private concerts and parties.<ref name="cbslocal1">[http://miami.cbslocal.com/2011/06/02/police-gun-found-in-car-of-man-killed-during-urban-beach-week/ "Man Shot To Death By Police Wanted In Boynton Beach Shooting", CBS Miami, June 2, 2011.]</ref>
=== Policy response === After a fatal shooting of an armed suspect by police in 2011, city leaders considered cutting back drinking hours or imposing a curfew; both ideas were considered unworkable. Also rejected was a plan to make the festival a city-sanctioned and organized event.<ref name="nytimes1"/>
Instead, the city and the Police Department increased the turnout of law enforcement in 2012, with a tougher stance on minor infractions.<ref name="nytimes1"/> Nearly 600 officers were on duty. Lanes were closed on the causeways leading to Miami Beach, and license plate readers were used to check for outstanding warrants, stolen cars and suspended licenses. Watch towers were put up to better observe the main promenade on Ocean Drive.<ref name="nytimes1"/>
Civil-rights groups expressed their concern in a letter signed by executive director of the ACLU of Florida, Howard Simon, former president of the Greater Miami ACLU chapter, [[John de Leon]], and Bradford E. Brown, president of the Miami-Dade NAACP, which said that Miami Beach officials were attempting "to make this event as difficult as possible for visitors to attend, creating the appearance that it is trying to discourage African Americans from visiting the City." <ref>[https://www.scribd.com/doc/94613741 ACLU-NAACP-Letter-to-City-of-Miami-Beach, May 23, 2012 ]</ref>
A total of 431 arrests were made during the 2012 event.<ref name="nytimes1"/> In 2012, police said that they removed 25 guns from the streets.<ref name="miamiherald2"/>
